body_html:
Tensor.new doesn't break the contract. It's a class unrelated to Variable, so its contract is that it returns a Tensor 😉

Parameters are really just ways of requiring the users to explicitly say which Variables do they want auto-saved by modules. They are never meant to be returned as a result of any operation, and this will not change.

I think you can resize them if you're in the no-grad mode, but I'm not 100% sure.

Tensor.new doesn't break the contract. It's a class unrelated to Variable, so its contract is that it returns a Tensor 😉
Parameters are really just ways of requiring the users to explicitly say which Variables do they want auto-saved by modules. They are never meant to be returned as a result of any operation, and this will not change.
I think you can resize them if you're in the no-grad mode, but I'm not 100% sure.
body:
Tensor.new doesn't break the contract. It's a class unrelated to Variable, so its contract is that it returns a Tensor :wink:

Parameters are really just ways of requiring the users to explicitly say which Variables do they want auto-saved by modules. They are never meant to be returned as a result of any operation, and this will not change.

I think you can resize them if you're in the no-grad mode, but I'm not 100% sure.
